intro: Psychotria tatamana, commonly known as the "blue psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Psychotria tatamana is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
